public abstract class BaseActions<V>
extends Object
implements ContextAware<V>

BaseActions

public BaseActions()
Method Detail

getContext

public Context<V> getContext()
The current context for use with action methods. Updated immediately before action calls.

Returns:
the current context

setContext

public void setContext(@NotNull
                       Context<V> context)
ContextAware interface implementation.

Specified by:
setContext in interface ContextAware<V>
Parameters:
context - the context

NODE

public Node<V> NODE(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the first parse tree node found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

NODES

public List<Node<V>> NODES(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of all parse tree nodes found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

NODE_BY_LABEL

public Node<V> NODE_BY_LABEL(String labelPrefix)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the first parse tree node found with the given label prefix. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix
Returns:
the action parameter

NODES_BY_LABEL

public List<Node<V>> NODES_BY_LABEL(String labelPrefix)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of all parse tree nodes found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix
Returns:
the action parameter

LAST_NODE

public Node<V> LAST_NODE()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the last node created during this parsing run. This last node is independent of the current context scope, i.e. BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object) have no influence on it.

Returns:
the action parameter

VALUE

public V VALUE()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the tree value of the current context scope level, i.e., if there is an explicitly set value it is returned. Otherwise the last non-null child value, or, if there is no such value, null.

Returns:
the action parameter

VALUE

public V VALUE(Node<V> node)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the value of the given node.

Parameters:
node - the node the get the value from
Returns:
the action parameter

VALUE

public V VALUE(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the value of the node found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to VALUE(NODE(path)).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

VALUES

public List<V> VALUES(List<Node<V>> nodes)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of the values of all given nodes.

Parameters:
nodes - the nodes to get the values from
Returns:
the action parameter

VALUES

public List<V> VALUES(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of the values of all nodes found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to VALUES(NODES(path)).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

LAST_VALUE

public V LAST_VALUE()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the value of the last node created during this parsing run. Equivalent to VALUE(LAST_NODE()).

Returns:
the action parameter

TEXT

public String TEXT(Node<V> node)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the input text matched by the given parse tree node.

Parameters:
node - the parse tree node
Returns:
the action parameter

TEXT

public String TEXT(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the input text matched by the node found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to TEXT(NODE(path)).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

TEXTS

public List<String> TEXTS(List<Node<V>> nodes)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of the input texts matched by all given nodes.

Parameters:
nodes - the nodes
Returns:
the action parameter

TEXTS

public List<String> TEXTS(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of the input texts matched by of all nodes found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to TEXTS(NODES(path)).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the action parameter

LAST_TEXT

public String LAST_TEXT()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the input text matched by the last node created during this parsing run. Equivalent to TEXT(LAST_NODE()).

Returns:
the action parameter

Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the first character of the input text matched by the given parse tree node.

Returns:
the action parameter

Returns:

CHARS

public List<Character> CHARS(String path)
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to a list of the first characters of the input texts matched by of all nodes found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to CHARS(NODES(path)).

Parameters:

Returns:

LAST_CHAR

public Character LAST_CHAR()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the first character of the input text matched by the last node created during this parsing run. Equivalent to CHAR(LAST_NODE()).

Returns:
the action parameter

SET

public boolean SET()
Creates a special action rule that sets the value of the parse tree node to be created for the current context scope to the value of the last node created during the current parsing run. Equivalent to SET(LAST_VALUE()).

Returns:
a new rule

SET

public boolean SET(V value)
Creates a special action rule that sets the value of the parse tree node to be created for the current context scope to the given value.

Parameters:
value - the value to set
Returns:
a new rule

NEXT_CHAR

public Character NEXT_CHAR()
Creates an action parameter that evaluates to the next input character about to be matched.

Returns:
the action parameter

IN_PREDICATE

public boolean IN_PREDICATE()
Returns true if the current rule is running somewhere underneath a test/testNot rule. Useful for example for making sure actions are not run inside of a predicate evaluation: return sequence( ..., inPredicate() || actions.doSomething() );

Returns:
true if in a predicate
